avalancheActivity.comment:
Above 2000 m avalanche danger is moderate. The snowdrift problem prevails above 2000 m, the wet-snow problem will intensify as the day progresses. Danger zones for slab avalanches occur esp. in steep ridgeline terrain and laterally wind-loaded terrain (discontinuities, precipices in the terrain) above 2000m esp. on north-facing slopes, releases mostly by large additional loading, by 1 person in isolated cases.
Apart from that, moist loose-snow avalanche danger will rise during the daytime, natural triggerings possible in extremely steep terrain.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snowdrift problem above 2000 m. Likelihood of wet-snow avalanches triggering will rise due to higher temperatures.

snowpackStructure.comment: The fresh fallen snow from the last week can continue to settle. Due to higher temperatures the snowpack surface is moist-to-wet; it is dry only on shady high-alpine slopes.

tendency.comment: On Saturday, very sunny and mild. Avalanche danger will be subject to a daytime danger cycle.

weatherForecast.comment: Friday will be predominantly sunny, but clouds will move in during the daytime hours, only isolated rain showers. Intensifying SW winds. At 2000 m: 0 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. Main problem: wet snow. Naturally triggered wet-snow slides are possible on extremely steep slopes.

snowpackStructure.comment: Along the Styrian rimline ranges and in the Wechsel region the snowpack is settling. Due to higher temperatures the snowpack surface is moist-to-wet. Near slopes which were bare of snow prior to the recent precipitation, bonding to the warm ground is poor, the snowpack tends to glide over smooth ground.

tendency.comment: On Saturday, very sunny and mild. Avalanche danger will be subject to a daytime danger cycle.

weatherForecast.comment: Friday will be predominantly sunny, but clouds will move in during the daytime hours, only isolated rain showers. Intensifying SW winds. At 2000 m: 0 degrees.
